Alandia Nord 80 10/12 Sullom Voe/UKCont W95 Elf
Vancouver Spirit 80 13/12 Santan/Yosu RNR LG Intl.

OSLO, Nov 29 (Reuter) - Norway's debt market rose sharply on the back of record breaking German Bunds. Market players said a stronger Norwegian crown and the announcement of a sufficiently tight 1997 final budget proposal helped the market.
The government unveiled its final budget draft and said it would maintain the same restrictive fiscal policy as in the first draft in October despite opposition pressure to raise public spending.
Analysts said they were pleased with the final budget proposal.
"The government has shown restraint and skill in manoeuvring in parliament and has put forward a good fiscal policy," said Olav Rune Oeverland, chief analyst at Den norske Bank.

"Finance Minister (Jens) Stoltenberg has shown a will to force through a tight budget, which is central to the long-term perspective in light of the growing surplus.It should be positive for the financial markets "
